As of today I would not recommend them.  Two weeks ago I went in to get a new radio for my car.  They promised the one they put in with all the bells and whistles would be
perfect.  Well the radio came in with wrong parts as they had reorder that was fine.  Finally they had all they needed although they kept calling saying you need this and that we said ok.  We took my car to them and they had it 4 days.  Finally after a lot of phone calls they said it was done.  It tried to sync my phone and it did but no sound out of the speakers.  They couldn't figure out the problem so the installer promised he'd call the manufacturer Monday morning and call me.  No phone call.  I called him and got his voice mail.  No return call.  I called the shop and was told they would call as soon as he got in .  No call.  I also called Sirus to have that transferred from my other radio but they didn't hook it up.  So here I sit with a very expensive radio and CD player.  At this point the ball is in their court and I'm waiting to see what they do. Until then I would no recommend them to anyone.
I now will give them 5 stars.  They have fixed my problems and everything works perfect.

I would go to them again.

resp.text:
Steve,

name: Matt S
text:
Shady company ran by dishonest owners that will lie to you in order to keep your business.

TSI Alarms also lied to me multiple times by saying that equipment installed by them (Qolsys IQ Panel 2) can ONLY work with TSI Alarms, and that if I cancel my account with them the panel will become useless. I was told that this info came directly from the TSI owners. They also said my doorbell video and other automations (lights, etc.) will not work if I canceled with them. They say that no other company will be able to use the equipment and it will only work with TSI since it was "theirs". They say that you cannot buy the Qolsys IQ Panel 2 online, because it comes from their dealer. This is all false.

They will also tell you that they don't know if they are allowed to cancel your account and that they don't know how to cancel accounts (and you have to call alarm.com to cancel). After multiple times calling alarm.com, I found out that you do in fact cancel with the dealer (TSI), not with them (they are just a third party software company). The lady at TSI needed to speak to her supervisor (but they were conveniently gone for the day), and she would call me first thing in the morning about if they can cancel/how to cancel my account (wouldn't you know, they never called back, I had to call them). The next morning, my call was passed around to 3 individuals until I spoke to somebody who wanted to make sure I 100% wanted to cancel my account (for all the reasons above). My alarm.com account was gone less than 5 minutes after I hung up. It was a fun few days of conversations.

Edit: Thanks for responding M. Moore. I WAS a customer of yours, so I CAN leave a review on your company (I went to a different company because TSI is dishonest). Everything I've posted is 100% truth. You need to check your employees training if what you've read above is not how you want them interacting with customers. Shady.

resp.text:
Matt,

You have over complicated this entire situation. It is actually very simple. The cellular device that is built into the Qolsys panel is registered to our company, TSI. You would need another company to replace that device. Of course the Qolsys panel is available online to anyone that would want to purchase it at a retail price. All the other automation devices that were installed in the home are also universal and can be used with any other company. You were not told that. That was your misunderstanding. You were actually told that the automation devices would no longer be free because TSI would no longer be providing that service. That is an agreement between TSI, DR Horton & the Alarm.com builder program. You can’t just have some random company give you a free Alarm.com account. I would think this would clear up any confusion you have. Like I said it’s very simple. You would need another company to replace the device.

Also please do not reach out to TSI to assist or help you for any other reason. We take our reputation and reviews very serious. We also do not appreciate you, who is not a customer going online as you if you are and giving our company a 1 star review. You are not a customer & do not reserve that right. We have been in business for 21 years. I can also tell you that during that time I have never been accused of being shady. That is slander! You need to be very careful with your words. We are upfront and honest to a fault. We did not tell people what they want to hear in order to make a sale. We have lost many opportunities & sales over the years for that reason. The other company was willing to tell them what they wanted to here even though it was false and we were not.

Sincerely,
M. Moore
Vice President

After having TSI Alarms (previously DRC Security) at my former residence for over 6 years, it was a no-brainier to have them at the home I recently purchased.  I called and was able to easily select and setup the equipment I wanted to install with their billing manager Rachel.

Rachel was beyond helpful in working with me to find a package of equipment that met my needs and my budget.  She ensured that I would have enough equipment to cover all of the home and to provide the wireless option I was looking for (so I do not have to have a land-line).  She scheduled a prompt installation that met our schedule with no problem.

On installation day two technicians Chris and Tony were sent to my home to install the system.  My husband was there to oversee the project and said they were both professional and courteous.  The techs cleaned up after themselves and ensured they discussed placement of all equipment with my husband so the alarm operated at its best performance.

If you are thinking of purchasing an alarm for your home I highly recommend TSI Alarms for their service.  Shop Local!

text: Paid for original iPhone 11 screen and come to find out when the new update installed my Face ID doesn’t work. Took it to the apple store and verified the screen was not original but generic 🤬. I will be reporting to Better Business!!!!!! College students beware

resp.text:
Dear customer,

I’m sorry to hear about your disappointment, we repair screens on cellular phones according to the customer’s request, we carry the OEM original led screens and the high copy screens that cost less. The OEM original copy we work with, offers you lifetime warranty from the manufacturer.

Apple stores of course know the difference since they are the only ones authorized to replace the Apple original screens and they know when you fix it somewhere else, they care about it because you didn’t fix it with them. As a retail store we put our stamp behind the screen to validate the manufacturer warranty and when Apple stores see our stamp they will tell you that it is not their screen.

Please come back to our shop and give us the opportunity to test your device and validate the warranty we offer you. This will not cost you anything and we will check the reason why your Face ID is not working properly, also we would like to know the location where your device was fixed and when it was fixed.

We like to share with you that our goal is not just to repair devices, it is to make sure you are satisfied with our service by doing it right and keep our customers happy because we care about all of you. Every day we try our best to satisfy our customers as we stand behind our repairs. As I mentioned before we will take care of your device and will make sure you have the OEM original led screen and as I said it already you don’t have to worry about it, it is under warranty and we will do our best to make you satisfied.

Please email me for future questions or concerns at Tuscaloosawireless@gmail.com

Sincerely,

Store manager, Abe.

name: Dianne Richard
text: Installation techs were knowledgeable.  However we purchased a keyless entry/ exit door feature.  This was an option that was very important to us and so we chose a security company that offered it.  When the installation tech arrived I was told that it could not be installed because I didn't have a dead bolt lock on the door.  That I could hire someone else to drill a hole in my door at additional cost.  Already paid $2500 for this security system and now I have to hire someone else to install the door lock.  I  called the salesperson and was told that she could get her husband to drill it. But then he couldn't because he was out of town.  So  3 days later got the hole drilled but when tech came back to install it the lock would jam.  Tech said they never drill door locks.  ADS doesn't pay for that tool because it is so expensive. Very frustrating!  Be careful with the salesperson!  Finally works after spending hours adjusting the door and lock.  Use another security company. Not ADS.

resp.text: Ms. Richard, I am sorry for the installation issues your encountered.  Please call us directly if you have any other issues.  We will be happy to work with you to make sure you are a satisfied customer.

name: Julia Milstead
text: When everything is working properly the internet, television, and phone service is good. When there is an outage the customer service is terrible. The wait time for a service call is normally over a week! Most of the outages are resolved before the service call is done, which would indicate a problem on MediaCom’s side rather than a problem with the in home equipment. Neighbors have the same issue, burnt I am always told there are no outages in the area and that my problem is an isolated one. I am very frustrated with the customer service. I have been a Mediacom customer for many, many years, but if I had any other option I would definitely change!!

resp.text: Hello, thank you for your review and for bringing this to our attention! We strive to provide better services and a customer experience than this, and we would like the opportunity to address this with you. Please feel free to reach out us at SocialMediaTeam@mediacomcc.com with any questions or concerns that you have and we will work to improve your overall service experience with us.Also, if our representatives were able to assist you, let us know by changing the review score. This will help us know where the improvements are.

name: Tzu Han Wang
text: Worst internet connection services, the internet goes to outages all the time

resp.text: Hello, I understand the frustration this has caused for you and this isn't the quality of service we want to provide to our customers. Please feel free to reach out us at socialmediateam@mediacomcc.com with any questions or concerns that you have and we will work to improve your overall service experience with us. Please send the account number, the address of the office you reviewed, and a summary of the issues. This way our total care representatives can track this issue and assist you with getting this resolved. Thank you!

text: What ever you do, avoid using Mediacom.   Their service is very unreliable.  Outages every month, sometimes, weekly.   As I'm writing this, their cable service is out again.  This time, it has been out since 8:25pm on Thursday 9/03/15, it is now 7:05am on Friday 9/04/15 and still no service.   I have spoken with several of Mediacom customer service reps. and all say the same thing, that Mediacom is working on the outrage in my area. This is  not true, if there is a problem after regular business hours, Mediacom does not work on it, Mediacom waits till the day to fix it.  I have had many different cable providers, but hands down, Mediacom is the worst !!!

name: Mark K.
text: I called ADT to request service/repair of 3 year old system, which was installed by ADT. Telephone Representative very helpful in setting up appt. She told me that there would be no charge for the service call as our monthly charge includes the warranty. Service appt. was for the next day - very quick in getting an appt. Service tech - Jonathon Givens - had to replace two door sensors. He then proceeded to tell my wife that our system was outdated and needed to be updated. He offered to update it for a $100 fee. My wife told him she would have to speak with me first before we agreed to anything resulting in a charge. Jonathon then asked my wife how long had we had our system. She told him three years in our current home and approximately seven years in our previous house (total of approximately ten years with ADT.)  He then said he'd go ahead and update our system for no charge, which he did. What was that about??  Offer to update the system for $100?  Would that be considered fleecing a client? And if he was going to update the system for $100, does he pocket the amount, since he updated the system anyway. Kind of "sketch" as the kids say these days.  I have not been impressed with ADT monitoring services in the past, and only continued service with them after the 2 year contract (at which time they were going to increase my monitoring price $10/month.) They agreed to keep it at the same rate as long as I agreed to another 2 years.  When the 2 years are over, I'm finished with ADT.

name: Jay Williams
text:
I was an 11 year customer of ADT. I was excited to move to a new home and take ADT with me. Unfortunately my mom passed away the day before ADT was set to install. Even under all that pressure I remembered to call and cancel the install while I was out of town. I've been out of pocket for weeks trying to handle mom's business, grieve, and still live so I haven't had a chance to reschedule. ADT proceeded to still charge me two months of service at my old location even though they knew I had cancelled the service at my old house. When I caught it, the call center manager told me that they still bill you 30 days after you cancel. I asked about the other month and she said "oh we prorated that and took it out of your installation fee." So I prepaid $100 for an install that I didn't get. And they took money out of my installation fee for two more months before I caught it. All this while they say sorry for your loss but...at least we gave you back the second month. So instead of $100 back I got about $50. Even during our time with them we were paying several months during one of their glitches and they weren't even monitoring my home.

No more ADT for me. EVER. And I'll let everyone I know not to get ADT. There are other options now.

resp.text: Hello Jay. Our condolences for your recent loss! We'd like to look into your concerns further to help. Could you please email us the phone number and address associated with your account to AlwaysThere@adt.com? Thank you. -Andrew

We just bought a home in the limits of Owens Cross Roads and the ONLY internet provider that provides for the area is New Hope Telephone CoOp. When the internet is working it is very nice.  However, for the last week, every single night when we go to watch television(we have Roku package and Netflix) in our bedroom instead of the living room, the wifi WILL NOT WORK. We have tried restarting the router and it's useless. We pay 75 dollars for the smallest internet package. It would be nice if it would actually work in our room, but 60% of the time it does not.

They gave us two wifi domains (I'm not sure about terminology) but 90% of the time only one is avaible. Which is extremely annoying.

Overall, I would not use this company but it is the only company we have as an option.   Sigh.

name: Daniel Martin
text:
Great and reliable service. I have just reviewed every telephone company in Alabama and all the people that take the time to write a review say they wish they had some other provider...kind of funny.  New Hope Telephone averages one hour trouble repair responses which is absolutely unheard of today, get that from AT&T, Comcast, Charter or any other provider, try 2 to 7 days from those companies.  Oh by the way it won't be long and we will have GIG internet availability as well...not bad from a rural provider when Birmingham, Mobile, Montgomery and Huntsville doesn't even have it yet.

The reason that NHTC is most people’s only ISP provider is the cost of operation and homes-per-mile available to serve. Other companies are free to serve the same area but choose not to due to the low profitability. NHTC isn’t a monopoly by choice but they are the only company that strives to provide service to an area that would otherwise not have it. That’s why telecom cooperatives were created by the people they serve. Great service and great employees!

One of our employees accidentally broke their key off in our lock this morning. I called 2 other locksmiths and no one could get by to look at it today. Finally, I found the Flying Locksmiths. Their dispatch was very courteous and assured they could get someone out today.

Sure enough, Willis arrived and had the broken key out in minutes. He even diagnosed the issue that was causing our keys to stick in the lock and fixed it too AND made a new copy of the broken key. All in under 15 minutes.

Very impressed by their service and skills and I know they will be the company we use for any future needs.

After searching around for an extended battery with no luck, that was until I found Spy Pro  Shop! They made it possible for me to have a battery that will last from 2 to 6 months without changing it (so excited).  It has been a week now, and is still  showing 100% (yes!).
The Spy Pro Shop customer service was exquisite!  So friendly, patience, and prompt on returning my trackimo to me, after I asked them to fix it to where I could have an extended battery life on it.
I would definitely recommend this shop to others!!!

name: CRI Trains
text: I was interested in purchasing a wifi security camera, purchased a unit only to get it home and find out that the unit did not have wifi.  I brought it back and they insisted that in fact it did.  Called the support number included they confirmed the unit did not have wifi.  Brought it back a second time for a refund and the lady behind the counter was quite rude and acted as if she did not believe me.  I would avoid this place.

resp.text: I'm sorry for the confusion, the camera was wifi enabled but was made to be covert therefore the controls were hidden behind a slide off panel that was not easily detected. I hope Mr. Hammer does not avoid this place as we would love to see him back as a customer. If by chance Mr. Hammer, you do order that camera online, we found that the entire rear panel will pop off with a little pressure and reveal the wifi switch. This was an upgraded model and I'm sorry that our people had not yet become familiar with it.
